channel.title: Portal 2 delayed, E3 Surprise “Portal 2 Themed”
channel.description:
In a new press release Valve has announced that Portal 2 has been pushed back until a 2011 release date, and the E3 surprise is pertaining to Portal 2. [quote] Aperture Science, doing business as Aperture Laboratories LLC, in partnership with Valve today announced the successful completion of an ethics-review-panel-supervised release date restructuring process. Portal 2, the sequel to the ground-breaking title that earned over 30 Game of the Year awards despite missing its original ship date, is now targeted for a 2011 release.
Representatives from both companies acknowledged that public safety concerns factored into the decision. They went on to say that even though Portal 2 will arrive slightly later than planned, all life on earth won't instantaneously stop as every molecule in your body explodes at the speed of light, which is what would happen should a rip ever appear in the fabric of Valve Time.
"Also, the game will be even better," they added, missing an historic opportunity to create the first product delay press release to mention that a product is being delayed to make it worse.
To ask questions about how close we all came to dying, or to ask futile questions about the previously announced E3 ***PORTAL-2-THEMED-FOR-GOD'S SAKE*** surprise or, less futilely, to schedule an appointment to attend a Portal 2 screening at the Valve booth during E3, please contact Valve's delegate to the EU's Valve Time Studies Group, Doug Lombardi. [/quote] [url='https://www.halflife2.net/2010/06/09/portal-2-delayed-e3-surprise-portal-themed/']Source[/url]

item.title: Portal 2 delayed, E3 Surprise “Portal 2 Themed”
item.dc:creator: geekofalltrades
item.description:
The Office is fail and shit.

As for Valve, we have absolutely no reason not to have faith in them. They’ve done this same thing with almost every game they’ve released. Even the original Half-Life was delayed for a year before its release.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 delayed, E3 Surprise “Portal 2 Themed”
item.dc:creator: johnyo
item.description:
Garfuncle:

That’s like saying Nintendo will drop Mario for several years. Not gonna happen. So at E3 I am predicting that they will most likely release a teaser trailer for Half-Life 3.

HL to HL2 - 6 years
HL2 to ep1 - 2 years

And I do remember reading somewhere that valve will not make HL trailers anymore because of the ep2 trailer.

Aaand ep3 kinda should come out before HL3 (which we probably won’t see until 2020 or something.)

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 delayed, E3 Surprise “Portal 2 Themed”
item.dc:creator: Garfuncle
item.description:
People are being too pessimistic. They said it wasn’t going to be Half-Life 2: Episode 3. And that’s a really, really, really good thing. Half-Life 2, while still amazing, is an outdated game base. And by this time, they would have transferred whatever work they did on EP: 3 to a newer current base. Valve isn’t going to leave their flagship game in limbo. That’s like saying Nintendo will drop Mario for several years. Not gonna happen. So at E3 I am predicting that they will most likely release a teaser trailer for Half-Life 3.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 delayed, E3 Surprise “Portal 2 Themed”
item.dc:creator: DiePoente
item.description:
Garfuncle:

Is the Portal team the same as the Half-Life team? I’m not sure, but I really don’t think so. Key Valve members are behind it but that doesn’t mean that nothing is being developed by the Half-Life team.

No. 8 people founded the concept of Portal. Valve hired them. And “only” them worked on it. Now, 28 people work on P2. So, many Valve employees help them.

Read full topic
